data.title: Shmuel Agnon – Prize presentation
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1966 was divided equally between Shmuel Yosef Agnon "for his profoundly characteristic narrative art with motifs from the life of the Jewish people" and Nelly Sachs "for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength"
data.text:
Shmuel Agnon

Prize presentation

Your browser does not support the video tag.

Watch a video clip of the 1966 Nobel Laureate in Literature, Shmuel Agnon, receiving his Nobel Prize medal and diploma during the Nobel Prize Award Ceremony at the Concert Hall in Stockholm, Sweden, on 10 December 1966.

To cite this section
